inn1.comm: short of length angling across the left-hander, Gayle moves his bat out of the way
short of length, but he loses direction and it  goes wide outside off
back of length, swings into Gayle from around leg stump, he gets hit on the thigh pad as he tries to glance, batsmen exchange ends as the ball rolls towards leg gully
full and swinging in to Powell, he goes for a flick but misses the ball completely, gets hit on the pads. The ball pitched middle and leg but swung a long way and that saves Powell
length ball across the left-hander, left alone
this one swings away from the batsman, but this goes wide outside off and the umpire stretches his arms again
this one is closer to the line of off and it beats Powell's forward prod
and another one past the edge as Powell goes fishing for one outside off, his feet not anywhere near the pitch of the delivery
starts of with a perfect outswinger, Gayle stays in the crease and plays inside the line
136 ks, and another outswinger. Starts outside off and swings further away. Gayle keeps his bat away from the line of the ball
this one is a touch wider outside off, swings away, no problems in letting that one go
and brings this closer to off and takes it away from there. Gayle stays within the crease and plays down the wrong line. He is not getting beaten by those one, it is just that he hangs his bat
fuller length, wide outside off, swings away and this time Gayle keeps his bat tucked in
fuller length outside off, bounces a lot after pitching and Wade takes it over his head
back of length on off stump, Powell stays on the back foot and defends it back  to the bowler
on a length, round about middle stump line and takes off from there, the batsman gets hit on the back leg, around thigh-pad
fuller length outside off, Powell stays in the crease and crunches it to the off side, but straight to mid-off
angles across the left-hander, it is bowled on a fuller length and Powell leaves it comfortably
135 ks, on a length a touch outside off, leaves the left-hander with the angle, left alone easily.
he shuffles across and punches the length ball on middle and leg to the right of the square-leg fielder. It doesn't go too far and was in the air for a fair bit
back of a length just outside off, Powell goes back and defends the swinging delivery towards point
shuffles across to play the short of length delivery on middle stump towards leg side, gets a leading edge back down the pitch. Lucky that it went straight down on the pitch
and keeps shuffling across, but the line on this ball is a bit straight and it allows Powell to whip it through midwicket
lovely delivery! starts of just outside off and swings away. Beats Powell who was waiting on his back foot
he gets a gift and drives it firmly through the covers. Starch experimented by pushing it all the way to the batsman
another one on similar length, very full, but it is pitched on middle and leg and hits the batsman on the pads as he shuffles across, the angle on that delivery saves Powell.
135 ks, short of length delivery on off and middle, defended down the pitch off the back foot
he stays on the back foot and defends the back of length delivery towards the off side
short ball outside off, Gayle is a bit late on that as he plays a whip/pull through midwicket and look at the power on that, it beats the fielder to the rope
fuller length on off stump, angles across Gayle and beats the outside edge. Wade takes it head high

caught at second slip! short  of length on off stump, leaves the batsman and bounces a touch extra too, it takes the shoulder of the bat on it's way to the slip cordon and Finch dives across and catches it in front of the first slip fielder, it carried at a nice height this one, a super catch to send the big man back
gets a leg-cutter first up, it is well outside off and so it's left alone
full and swinging and Powell beautifully leans on that one and creams it through cover for his second boundary through that region

caught at first slip! So that is what Starc has been setting Powell up for. It is another swinging delivery on off stump, but the length is pulled back just a bit, only just, and it takes the outside edge and goes straight to Michael Clarke for the easiest of slip catches. Two Down
139 ks, very full and swinging away, Bravo gets squared up and ends up edging it towards point
fuller length delivery outside off, swings in to Sarwan who pushes it to cover point off the front foot

hits middle and leg!!! Well well well, it is made me jump off my seat. It is full and swinging and fast and what not... Sarwan plays all over it and it goes through the gate and disarrays the nice lattice that the stumps are laid in.
length ball touch outside off, comes in a touch, but Dwayne covers the line of the stumps and lets it go
fuller length delivery on off, Darren doesn't come fully forward, but defends it to leg side
and this one carries on with the angle! Darren was playing for the swing and it goes past the outside edge
back of length angling across the left-hander, Darren pulls his bat in at the last moment
on the middle and leg line, seams a touch away after pitching and Darren ends up defending back to the bowler
short of length outside off, a confident leave from Darren this time
short-ish delivery on off stump, not too quick, Darren hops and defends it down the pitch

is that caught! is that lbw! Whatever it is, it is another wicket! It is bat-pad to short leg. Starc keeps it there, full, fast and swinging on the middle stump, Dwayne, unlike Sarwan, takes a stride out to the ball, but it takes the inside edge, hits the pads and goes straight to short-leg fielder

oh my god!!! another one full, fast and swinging, hits the pads at a ferocious pace and Polly's bat is nowhere near the ball, it pitches in line of leg stump and hits him in line. Decision reviewed. It looked good to me, but the DRS thingy saves Polly, as it was clipping the leg stump with the outer half
take this one then!! Full inswinging delivery outside off, Polly doesn't get too far forward and chops the ball back to the stumps. That's out twice in two balls in my book.
full yorker outside off, how did that miss the off stump. Everyone has their hands on their heads..
full yorker again and somehow Thomas digs it out. Survives to live another day.
this one is a touch shorter in length, but it keeps coming back in and hits the batsman on the thigh
edged and goes through the vacant third slip! length ball, leaves Bravo, who plays at it without much of a forward stride
leaves the ball on length outside off, but I tell you, that just went over the off stump. Good leave, some would say, at the WACA
fuller length on off stump, punched to mid-on
short of length with width outside off, cut with power, but straight to point
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller length outside off, Thomas goes for a drive but ends up slicing it past the left of a diving point fielder
fuller length delivery wide outside off, swinging away and Darren caresses it through cover for a boundary
length ball on off stump, moves away from the bat, left alone by the batsman
tests him with a bouncer outside off stump, Darren was going forward and had to sway away at the last moment
142 ks, full and swinging outside off, a touch too full, Bravo defends it back to the bowler
keeps it nice and full outside off, the batsman drives with an open face, towards cover point
another short delivery, this time Bravo sees it early and ducks under it
127 ks, nice gentle delivery on a length compared to what has been spewed till now, it is tucked towards square leg for a single
gets some bounce outside off, defended off the backfoot, a bit awkwardly
not much swing for JF, it is on a length angling in to the left-hander, he comes forward and pushes it to wide mid-on
goes across the right hander and beats the outside edge as Thomas doesn't really stretch out to the pitch of the ball

caught at first slip! Success, triumph and fun for JF. A good start to his career and Thomas gives his wicket as a gift. It was short of length on off stump, angling across, and Thomas pokes at it, the edge flies comfortably to Clarke
gets a wide delivery outside off
fuller length on the middle stump line, moves a touch away too, pushed back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, swings away, Bravo gets squared up a bit as he defends it to the off side
and more of the same again, defended towards off side
full on the pads and that is flicked fine down to fine leg, where JF makes a full-length dive to cut off the boundary
short of length wide outside off, and that climbs from there and goes over the keeper's head..
back of length on the pads, Bravo hops and tucks it towards backward square leg
full and swinging outside off, just didn't come back as much as it did earlier, but it was enough to draw an inside edge to square leg
down the leg side and it's called a wide
fuller length delivery on the off stump, punched back straight down, mid-on and mid-off converge to stop that
length delivery on middle and leg line, not much swing for JF, pushed towards midwicket
loose shot by Lara as he flays his bat at a wide delivery and gets beaten
short of length outside off stump, defended towards the off side

caught my Mr. Clarke at you know where! As simple as you like. Length delivery on off stump, moves a touch away after pitching and Bravo plays that from the back foot when probably he should have been forward, the ball takes a proper edge and goes straight to first slip
the tall debutant plays a positive defensive shot off a length ball
he tries the same formula as Starc, bowls full outside off, but it doesn't swing much and is defended back to the bowler
another fuller one outside off, Sammy pushes it in the gap at cover for a couple
this one was much straighter and Sammy played at that from the crease, lucky that he got an inside edge on to his pads
short of length on middle and leg, glanced down to fine-leg off the back foot
edged and falls short of the second-slip fielder. Holder does well as he takes his bottom hand off as he plays that short of length delivery off the back foot
he is back to his favourite length, which is a bit short of good length, it goes across the right hander who leaves it alone
slightly slower length delivery on off, defended off the back foot
keeps it around the off stump and Sammy defends off the back foot towards the leg side
full yorker outside off, misses everything, Sammy was late to bring his bat down
now he plays outside the line of the ball, it goes between the bat and pad to the keeper
short of length and a touch wide outside off, left alone
keeps it tight outside off, Sammy stays in the crease and lifts his bat out of the way
length delivery on off, not much movement for him, defended by the batsman back to the bowler
oh my my!! That was a fast full inswinging yorker, and he just gets his bat down in time to get an inside edge to the leg side
length ball on middle and leg, 145 ks, hits the pads but on this pitch, generally those ones sail over the stumps, no appeal
swings it down the leg side, called a wide

no no! The pitch saves the batsman. It was bowled on a length, pitched on the middle line, swung in and what does Sammy do? he leaves it. The ball hits the pads and everyone goes for a loud appeal. Good leave in hindsight
short of length, bounces a touch extra and hits the thigh pad
short of length on the pads, hits the thigh pad and rolls towards backward square leg
a big swing and a miss, Sammy sees width and throws his bat at it, playing away from the body, lucky not to edge that one
takes it away from the right-hander, from short of length, left alone
nice flick fine on the leg side off a length ball on the pads, just a single
quick short ball around leg stump, Holder goes for a pull and misses, the keeper goes up for a caught behind appeal, but it didn't touch anything
fuller on off, Holder comes forward and pushes it to wide mid-off for a quick single
not out given! It flicked something on the way to the keeper. It was short of length delivery on off stump, got up a bit and flicked the elbow or something on the way to the keeper.
attempts a yorker, but it's a low fullt-toss, driven to wide mid-off
short of length delivery on the middle stump, tucked away towards midwicket off the back foot
full and wide, the batsman has a poke at that one, but doesn't make a connection
length ball on the middle, Sammy makes room but the ball swings back into him and hits the thigh pad
full and swinging, but it's going down the leg side, it hits the inside edge, then the pad, but comes back on the crease. That short-leg guys is waiting there
length ball on middle and leg, swings back in, Sammy plays that to fine leg off the back foot
short of length delivery, angled across, left alone by the batsman
lures the batsman with one that is pushed up fuller, the angles takes it past the outside edge of the bat
short of length on off stump, and Sammy plays a short-arm jab on one leg to send it over mid-on for a couple. 50 up
length ball going across the batsman, easily left alone
driven in the air, but it is in the gap at cover and Sammy gets more from this over. It was a length ball outside off and there was a big gap at cover to aim at
full yorker outside off, beats the bat and Wade takes it shoulder high
fuller delivery wide outside off, safely left alone by the batsman
length ball on off, pushed to cover and the batsmen set off after some hesitation, could have been close has the fielder hit the stumps at the non-striker's end
short delivery on off, Sammy gets into a tangle as he tries to pull it, the ball still goes over the bat and up over the keeper's head
fuller ball outside off, the batsman tries to go through cover with his drive, but ends up playing it back to the bowler as it hits the inside half of the bat
charges out, makes some room and smashes it hard with a hammer of a shot through mid-off, all along the ground
keeps strike as he drops this one softly on the off side and calls for a quicks single

caught at midwicket! Here comes the wicket. Short of length on off and middle, Sammy tries to flick it to the leg side , but the ball gets big on him and it takes a leading edge. It could have been McKay's catch, but he slips in his follow through, but there is ample time for the fielder at midwicket to jog in and swallow that one
full down the leg side, hits the pads on its way to the keeper
length delivery angled across the left-handed Narine, he tucks his bat in and keeps it away from the ball
short of length delivery on the middle, defended off the back foot
length ball on off stump, defended towards the leg side off the front foot
short of length delivery angles across and goes past the outside edge
length ball a touch outside off, carries on with the angle, left alone by the batsman
full and wide outside off, very wide, called a wide, rightly so
what solid defence there! Positive stride to a length ball, meets the ball under his eye and defends it to off
and straight on the back foot spotting the shorter length, defended towards point
nicely tucked away to deep backward square off one which is short of length and on the body
short of length on the body, defended towards the leg side
full and swining in on middle and leg stump line, Holder gets his bat down in time and pushes it back to the bowler
another one goes past Narine's edge as he pushes at an angled delivery inside the line of the ball
more lessons on how to survive an edge from Narine
make it three in a row.
and more, no. 4
and again. No 5
No. 6 is not Narine's lucky number surely. After five attempts to get out, he succeeds off the sixth delivery and edges it through to the keeper.
he makes room by moving outside leg, and flat bats the short of length delivery to mid-on
full and fast yorker on the middle stump, Roach bottom edges it on to his boot, just in time
stays on the back foot and steers the length delivery outside off to third-man
another quick yorker on off stump and Holder shows how it's played, he blocks it out with some timing to cover
No. 5 for Mister Starc! Length ball on middle and leg, swings in. Mr. Holder had moved outside leg stump to send this over the bowler's head, but he misses and loses the leg-stump.

inn2.comm: first ball, short outside off, he hops and cracks it through in front of square off the back foot. In front of square? that was through cover actually
fuller length on off stump, punched back to the bowler off the front foot
fuller length outside off, and Maxwell is not wasting any time, he comes forward and crashes, just crashes, it through cover
oh my!! charges down and makes room by moving outside leg and blasts this through wide mid-off for boundary no. 3
oh what's going on, he moves his front leg out of the way and tennis -forehands this slightly short of length delivery into the stands at wide long-on
and he goes again, wants to send this out, but gets a bottom edge on this one, it rolls to mid-on
138 ks, on a length but is very wide, just inside the wide marker
short of length outside off, cracked through cover for a couple again
moves outside leg, but Holder bowls it wide outside off, and he gets a lot of bounce with his height, goes over the bat to the keeper
and slashes at it again, but the bounce takes it over the bat. Maxwell is moving about on the crease, he wants to finish things in a jiffy
Maxwell is doing a bit of Narine here (different shots though), third time in a row he makes no connection to one which bounces extra
ok, so he knows he is allowed to leave, lets this length delivery outside off go through
length ball on off, pushed to cover with soft hands and he calls for a quick single
charges out and makes room, gets a quick shorter delivery and has to move out of the way
the top-edge goes over the keeper's head. Maxwell is moving his front leg out every ball and is trying to play the fore-hand
fuller length and he again moves outside leg and drives it inside out, all the way into the crowd, well taken in the crowd.
short of length ball, goes past the outside edge, the keeper loses the ball as it rises a bit extra
another quick short of length ball, Maxwell is moving all around the crease, but stays away from this one
a play and a miss outside off, off a short of length wide delivery
short and wide, it is bouncing extra but these guys know how to play their tennis, played over cover with a horizontal bat
backs away and slices a length delivery over cover point for a couple

Mr DRS has been called into service. It was short of length outside off, the batsman stays in the crease and tries to flay his bat at that, it takes an outside edge, seemingly so, (I heard a noise), but the umpire says no. Being reviewed...Yes, it is out. Although it didn't show up clearly on the hot-spot, the noise was too loud to ignore. Holder 1 - hot-spot 0
beats him outside off with an angled delivery that bounces a touch extra
full and wide outside off, Khawaja tries to drive at that one away from his body, gets beaten
length ball on off, solidly defended down the pitch off the front foot
Maxwell goes reverse sweeping, the ball was heading down the leg side, but he sends this all along the ground to deep midwicket..errr. extra cover for a boundary
pushed through and spins in from off, tucked away to short fine
short delivery, but it's quick too, defended off the back foot
spins into the batsman and he gets hit on the thigh pad
turns into him, and he pulls it down to deep backward square
was that a drop! Maybe no. It is floated up to the batsman and it turns past the bat as Uzzie comes forward. The keeper doesn't take it cleanly. Yes, that took an edge.
moves way outside off and tries to pull the length delivery on the leg side, doesn't get hold of it, gets it as far as short fine
on the pads and it is tucked away to deep backward square for a couple
goes for a pull of a back of length delivery going across, but it is too quick for him and he gets beaten
short of length on the body, defended off the back foot towards the leg side
back of length on off, he hops and gets behind the line, plays it back to the bowler
length ball outside off, driven square on off side but Polly makes a one-handed stop
short of length, turns into the batsman, Maxwell pulls it along and smashes it to deep midwicket boundary
and goes for a power sweep off a flighted one, but hits the man at forward short leg. It hit the fielder on his shin pads
comes down the pitch, but the ball is flatter, he has to dab it to cover for a single
short and spins away from Uzzie, who uses the opportunity and cuts it hard past point to pick some welcome runs
93 ks, flat and quick on off, he comes forward an defends
flighted on middle and leg, it grips and turns past the bat. Uzzie beaten outside off
moves to the leg side, but the ball is full and it takes an inside edge to square leg
and tries to send this one down to downtown Perth by moving his front leg out of the way, the ball  comes in with the angles and goes between bat and pad
now goes all the way across to the off side, trying to paddle that over short fine, makes not connection
one bounce, two bounce, and it is a boundary over extra cover. What sort of short is that. He hammers this rising delivery from around his chest with a swat over cover
charges out and gets a full swinging delivery outside off, misses it
he shuffles across the stumps, not as animatedly as earlier, and misses the short of length delivery down the leg side.
spins away after pitching outside off, Uzzie cuts it to point, who misfields allowing a single
no he goes the other way with a reverse sweep, but makes no connection
that is more orthodox stuff, flighted delivery is smashed over the off side, inside out
he goes down the leg side and is called a wide, Maxwell wanted to send it to deep backward square
fifty for Maxwell as he cuts it hard through gully on the off side
short of length delivery, quick too, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
flighted delivery on off and middle, he comes forward to push it to the leg side, but misses as the ball turns and hits the pads
short of length wide outside off, moves away after passing the batsman who has left it alone
comes forward, plays a soft push to the offside and completes a quick single to hand out a big thrashing to the tourists
